api_token.description: The token used to connect to CAST AI API.

client_id.description: Azure AD application ID that is created and used by CAST AI.

client_secret.description: Azure AD application password that will be used by CAST AI.

delete_nodes_on_disconnect.description: Should CAST AI remove nodes managed by CAST.AI on disconnect.

node_resource_group.description: Azure resource group in which nodes are and will be created.

tenant_id.description: Azure AD tenant ID from the used subscription.

block.description: AKS cluster resource allows connecting an existing AKS cluster to CAST AI.

autoscaler_policies.description: computed value to store full policies configuration

autoscaler_policies_json.description: autoscaler policies JSON string to override current autoscaler settings

block.description: CAST AI autoscaler resource to manage autoscaler settings

cluster_token.description: computed value to store cluster token

assume_role_arn.description: AWS IAM role ARN that will be assumed by CAST AI user. This role should allow `sts:AssumeRole` action for CAST AI user that can be retrieved using `castai_eks_user_arn` data source

cluster_token.description: computed value to store cluster token

delete_nodes_on_disconnect.description: Should CAST AI remove nodes managed by CAST AI on disconnect

region.description: AWS region where the cluster is placed

block.description: EKS cluster resource allows connecting an existing EKS cluster to CAST AI.

credentials_id.description: CAST AI credentials id for cluster

credentials_json.description: GCP credentials.json from ServiceAccount with credentials for CAST AI

delete_nodes_on_disconnect.description: Should CAST AI remove nodes managed by CAST.AI on disconnect

location.description: GCP cluster zone in case of zonal or region in case of regional cluster

block.description: GKE cluster resource allows connecting an existing GKE cluster to CAST AI.

container_runtime.description: Optional container runtime to be used by kubelet. Applicable for EKS only.  Supported values include: `dockerd`, `containerd`

disk_cpu_ratio.description: Disk to CPU ratio. Sets the number of GiBs to be added for every CPU on the node. Defaults to 0

docker_config.description: Optional docker daemon configuration properties in JSON format. Provide only properties that you want to override. Applicable for EKS only. [Available values](https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/commandline/dockerd/#daemon-configuration-file)

image.description: Image to be used while provisioning the node. If nothing is provided will be resolved to latest available image based on Kubernetes version if possible

init_script.description: Init script to be run on your instance at launch. Should not contain any sensitive data. Value should be base64 encoded

kubelet_config.description: Optional kubelet configuration properties in JSON format. Provide only properties that you want to override. Applicable for EKS only. [Available values](https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/config-api/kubelet-config.v1beta1/)

min_disk_size.description: Minimal disk size in GiB. Defaults to 100, min 30, max 1000

ssh_public_key.description: SSH public key to be used for provisioned nodes

subnets.description: Subnet ids to be used for provisioned nodes

tags.description: Tags to be added on cloud instances for provisioned nodes

max_pods_per_node.description: Maximum number of pods that can be run on a node, which affects how many IP addresses you will need for each node. Defaults to 30

dns_cluster_ip.description: IP address to use for DNS queries within the cluster

imds_hop_limit.description: Allow configure the IMDSv2 hop limit, the default is 2

imds_v1.description: Allow IMDSv1, the default is true

instance_profile_arn.description: Cluster's instance profile ARN used for CAST provisioned nodes

key_pair_id.description: AWS key pair ID to be used for CAST provisioned nodes. Has priority over ssh_public_key

security_groups.description: Cluster's security groups configuration for CAST provisioned nodes

volume_iops.description: AWS EBS volume IOPS to be used for CAST provisioned nodes

volume_throughput.description: AWS EBS volume throughput in MiB/s to be used for CAST provisioned nodes

volume_type.description: AWS EBS volume type to be used for CAST provisioned nodes. One of: gp3, io1, io2

max_pods_per_node.description: Maximum number of pods that can be run on a node, which affects how many IP addresses you will need for each node. Defaults to 110

network_tags.description: Network tags to be added on a VM. (See [network tags](https://cloud.google.com/vpc/docs/add-remove-network-tags))

key_pair_id.description: AWS key pair ID to be used for provisioned nodes. Has priority over sshPublicKey

block.description: Create node configuration for given cluster. Node configuration [reference](https://docs.cast.ai/docs/node-configuration)

configuration_id.description: CAST AI node configuration id to be used for node template.

custom_instances_enabled.description: Marks whether custom instances should be used when deciding which parts of inventory are available. Custom instances are only supported in GCP.

custom_labels.description: Custom labels to be added to nodes created from this template. If the field `custom_label` is present, the value of `custom_labels` will be ignored.

rebalancing_config_min_nodes.description: Minimum nodes that will be kept when rebalancing nodes using this node template.

should_taint.description: Marks whether the templated nodes will have a taint.

architectures.description: List of acceptable instance CPU architectures, the default is amd64. Allowed values: amd64, arm64.

compute_optimized.description: Compute optimized instance constraint - will only pick compute optimized nodes if true.

fallback_restore_rate_seconds.description: Fallback restore rate in seconds: defines how much time should pass before spot fallback should be attempted to be restored to real spot.

spot.description: Spot instance constraint - true only spot, false only on-demand.

storage_optimized.description: Storage optimized instance constraint - will only pick storage optimized nodes if true

use_spot_fallbacks.description: Spot instance fallback constraint - when true, on-demand instances will be created, when spots are unavailable.

exclude_names.description: Names of the GPUs to exclude.

include_names.description: Instance families to include when filtering (excludes all other families).

manufacturers.description: Manufacturers of the gpus to select - NVIDIA, AMD.

max_count.description: Max GPU count for the instance type to have.

min_count.description: Min GPU count for the instance type to have.

exclude.description: Instance families to include when filtering (excludes all other families).

include.description: Instance families to exclude when filtering (includes all other families).

key.description: Label key to be added to nodes created from this template.

value.description: Label value to be added to nodes created from this template.

block.description: Custom label key/value to be added to nodes created from this template.

effect.description: Effect of a taint to be added to nodes created from this template. The effect must always be NoSchedule.

key.description: Key of a taint to be added to nodes created from this template.

value.description: Value of a taint to be added to nodes created from this template.

block.description: Custom taints to be added to the nodes created from this template. `shouldTaint` has to be `true` in order to create/update the node template with custom taints. If `shouldTaint` is `true`, but no custom taints are provided, the nodes will be tainted with the default node template taint.
CAST AI node template resource to manage node templates

enabled.description: The job will only be executed if it's enabled.

block.description: Job assigns a rebalancing schedule to a cluster.

node_ttl_seconds.description: Specifies amount of time since node creation before the node is allowed to be considered for automated rebalancing.

num_targeted_nodes.description: Maximum number of nodes that will be selected for rebalancing.

rebalancing_min_nodes.description: Minimum number of nodes that should be kept in the cluster after rebalancing.

cron.description: Cron expression defining when the schedule should trigger.

savings_percentage.description: Defines the minimum percentage of savings expected.

block.description: CAST AI rebalancing schedule resource to manage rebalancing schedules.
Retrieve IAM policy, IAM User Policy and instance profile policies for the specified cluster
